data.title: Film
data.text:
TV/Film

These are titles with TV or movie potential for which manuscript material or published books are available. Click on the author's name for reviews and more information.

titles with tv, movie, and documentary potential

Nicholas A. Basbanes, A Gentle Madness: Bibliophiles, Bibliomanes, and the Eternal Passion for Books

Nicholas A. Basbanes, On Paper: The Everything of Its Two-Thousand-Year History

Michael J. Behe, Darwin's Black Box: The Biochemical Challenge to Evolution

Harold Bloom, The American Religion

Max Boot, Invisible Armies: An Epic History of Guerrilla Warfare from Ancient Times to the Present

Max Boot, The Savage Wars of Peace: Small Wars and the Rise of American Power

Max Boot, War Made New: The Key Weapons, Battles, and Warriors That Changed the Course of History from 1500 to Today

David Brooks, The Social Animal: The Hidden Sources of Love, Character, and Achievement

Dale C. Carson and Wes Denham, Arrest-Proof Yourself: An Ex-Cop Reveals How Easy It Is for Anyone to Get Arrested, How Even a Single Arrest Could Ruin Your Life, and What to Do If the Police Get in Your Face

Wes Denham, Arrested: What to Do When Your Loved One's in Jail

Thomas M. Disch, 334

Thomas M. Disch, Camp Concentration

Thomas M. Disch, The Genocides

Andrew Ferguson, Crazy U: One Dad's Crash Course in Getting His Kid into College

David Gelernter, 1939: The Lost World of the Fair

Gabrielle Glaser, Her Best-Kept Secret: Why Women Drink—and How They Can Regain Control

Roya Hakakian, Assassins of the Turquoise Palace

Victor Davis Hanson, Carnage and Culture: Landmark Battles in the Rise of Western Power

Victor Davis Hanson, The End of Sparta: A Novel

Victor Davis Hanson, The Savior Generals: How Five Great Commanders Saved Wars That Were Lost, From Ancient Greece to Iraq

Arthur Herman, Freedom's Forge: How American Business Produced Victory in World War Two

Arthur Herman, Gandhi & Churchill: The Rivalry That Destroyed an Empire and Forged Our Age

Arthur Herman, The Idea of Decline in Western History

Charles Hill, Grand Strategies: Literature, Statecraft, and World Order

Eric Jager, Blood Royal: A True Tale of Crime and Detection in Medieval Paris

Eric Jager, The Last Duel: A True Story of Crime, Scandal, and Trial by Combat in Medieval France

Efraim Karsh, Islamic Imperialism: A History

Efraim Karsh, Palestine Betrayed

Melanie Kirkpatrick, Escape from North Korea: The Untold Story of Asia's Underground Railway

Edward Lazarus, Black Hills/White Justice: The Sioux Nation Versus the United States, 1775 to the Present

Edward Lazarus, Closed Chambers: The Rise, Fall, and Future of the Modern Supreme Court

Marty Makary, M.D., Unaccountable: What Hospitals Won't Tell You and How Transparency Can Revolutionize Health Care

Howard Markel, M.D., Ph.D., An Anatomy of Addiction: Sigmund Freud, William Halsted, and the Miracle Drug Cocaine

Howard Markel, M.D., Ph.D., When Germs Travel: Six Epidemics That Have Invaded America Since 1900 and the New Fears They Have Unleashed

Kevin J. McNamara, Dreams of a Great Small Nation: The Mutinous Army that Threatened a Revolution, Destroyed an Empire, Founded a Republic, and Remade the Map of Europe

Sue Mingus, Tonight at Noon: A Love Story

Gretchen Morgenson and Joshua Rosner, Reckless Endangerment: How Outsized Ambition, Greed, and Corruption Led to Economic Armageddon

Sherwin B. Nuland, The Doctor's Plague: Germs, Childbed Fever, and the Strange Story of Ignac Semmelweis

Sherwin B. Nuland, How We Die: Reflections on Life's Final Chapter

Michael B. Oren, Power, Faith, and Fantasy: America in the Middle East, 1776 to the Present

Michael B. Oren, Six Days of War: June 1967 and the Making of the Middle East

Steven Ozment, The Burgermeister's Daughter: Scandal in a Sixteenth-Century German Town

David A. Price, Love and Hate in Jamestown: John Smith, Pocahontas, and the Start of a New Nation

David A. Price, The Pixar Touch: The Making of a Company

Diane Ravitch, The Death and Life of the Great American School System: How Testing and Choice Are Undermining Education

Diane Ravitch, Reign of Error: The Hoax of the Privatization Movement and the Danger to America's Public Schools

James S. Romm, Dying Every Day: Seneca at the Court of Nero

James S. Romm, Ghost on the Throne: The Death of Alexander the Great and the War for Crown and Empire

Peter Schweizer, Throw Them All Out: How Politicians and Their Friends Get Rich Off Insider Stock Tips, Land Deals, and Cronyism That Would Send the Rest of Us to Prison

Christina Hoff Sommers, The War Against Boys: How Misguided Policies Are Harming Our Young Men—New and Revised Edition

Geoffrey R. Stone, Perilous Times: Free Speech in Wartime from the Sedition Act of 1798 to the War on Terrorism

Terry Teachout, Duke: A Life of Duke Ellington

Terry Teachout, Pops: A Life of Louis Armstrong

The Honorable Justice Clarence Thomas, My Grandfather's Son: A Memoir

Henry Ashby Turner, Jr., Hitler's Thirty Days to Power: January 1933

Paco Underhill, Why We Buy: The Science of Shopping—Updated and Revised for the Internet, the Global Consumer and Beyond

Oanh Ngo Usadi, Of Monkey Bridges and Banh Mi Sandwiches: From Saigon to Texas
